commit_message:
Added Test Case for InterfacesClient

This patch adds Unit Test Cases for InterfacesClient module.

Change-Id: I976fd1d91dc3db4006f32b30e859981120487b0b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/33/218133/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 NEC Corporation. All rights reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import httplib2 from oslo_serialization import jsonutils as json from oslotest import mockpatch from tempest.services.compute.json import interfaces_client from tempest.tests import base from tempest.tests import fake_auth_provider class TestImagesClient(base.TestCase): # Data Values to be used for testing # RESPONSE_CODE = 200 FAKE_INTERFACE_DATA = { "list": { "interfaceAttachments": [{ "fixed_ips": [{ "ip_address": "192.168.1.1", "subnet_id": "f8a6e8f8-c2ec-497c-9f23-da9616de54ef" }], "mac_addr": "fa:16:3e:4c:2c:30", "net_id": "3cb9bc59-5699-4588-a4b1-b87f96708bc6", "port_id": "ce531f90-199f-48c0-816c-13e38010b442", "port_state": "ACTIVE"}]}, "show": { "interfaceAttachment": { "fixed_ips": [{ "ip_address": "192.168.1.1", "subnet_id": "f8a6e8f8-c2ec-497c-9f23-da9616de54ef" }], "mac_addr": "fa:16:3e:4c:2c:30", "net_id": "3cb9bc59-5699-4588-a4b1-b87f96708bc6", "port_id": "ce531f90-199f-48c0-816c-13e38010b442", "port_state": "ACTIVE"}}} FAKE_SERVER_ID = "ec14c864-096e-4e27-bb8a-2c2b4dc6f3f5" FAKE_PORT_ID = FAKE_INTERFACE_DATA['show']['interfaceAttachment'] def setUp(self): super(TestImagesClient, self).setUp() fake_auth = fake_auth_provider.FakeAuthProvider() self.client = interfaces_client.InterfacesClient(fake_auth, "compute", "regionOne") def _test_interface_operation(self, operation="create", bytes_body=False): client_body = json.dumps(self.FAKE_INTERFACE_DATA['show']) if operation == 'list': expected_op = self.FAKE_INTERFACE_DATA['list'] client_body = json.dumps(self.FAKE_INTERFACE_DATA['list']) function = self.client.list_interfaces mock_operation = 'tempest.common.service_client.ServiceClient.get' params = {'server_id': self.FAKE_SERVER_ID} elif operation == 'show': expected_op = self.FAKE_INTERFACE_DATA['show'] function = self.client.show_interface mock_operation = 'tempest.common.service_client.ServiceClient.get' params = {'server_id': self.FAKE_SERVER_ID, 'port_id': self.FAKE_PORT_ID['port_id']} elif operation == 'delete': expected_op = False function = self.client.delete_interface mock_operation = 'tempest.common.service_client.ServiceClient.get' self.RESPONSE_CODE = 202 params = {'server_id': self.FAKE_SERVER_ID, 'port_id': self.FAKE_PORT_ID['port_id']} else: expected_op = False function = self.client.create_interface mock_operation = 'tempest.common.service_client.ServiceClient.post' params = {'server_id': self.FAKE_SERVER_ID, 'port_id': self.FAKE_PORT_ID['port_id']} self.RESPONSE_CODE = 202 if bytes_body: client_body = client_body.encode('utf-8') response = (httplib2.Response({'status': self.RESPONSE_CODE}), client_body) self.useFixture(mockpatch.Patch( mock_operation, return_value=response)) if expected_op: self.assertEqual(expected_op, function(**params)) def test_list_interfaces_with_str_body(self): self._test_interface_operation('list') def test_list_interfaces_with_bytes_body(self): self._test_interface_operation('list', True) def test_show_interface_with_str_body(self): self._test_interface_operation('show') def test_show_interface_with_bytes_body(self): self._test_interface_operation('show', True) def test_delete_interface_with_str_body(self): self._test_interface_operation('delete') def test_delete_interface_with_bytes_body(self): self._test_interface_operation('delete', True) def test_create_interface_with_str_body(self): self._test_interface_operation() def test_create_interface_with_bytes_body(self): self._test_interface_operation(bytes_body=True)

commit_message:
Rename Manila share network context

Rename context 'manila_share_networks' to 'share_networks' as it is
redundant to use name 'manila' when subdir already contains it.

commit_message:
Test that microversions are not skipped

When raising API_MAX_VERSION to support a new Nova API microversion
there should be support added to some method to account for the change.
A test has been added to catch if support has not been added.  In the
event that no methods need to change there is an exclusion mechanism in
the test so the version and a note can be added there.

Change-Id: Iebc1be2557e1b6eec327b703568805578e564172

Please do not ' 'raise API_MAX_VERSION without adding support or ' 'excluding them.' % unnacounted_for) self.assertEqual(set([]), unnacounted_for, failure_msg)

commit_message:
Fix NPIV migration failure with no attribute 'get'

If pre_live_migration_result is None in migrate_data in live_migration,
we would not be able to extract any value from None object.

Change-Id: Ia995cc58849b59e58bfa1053413c52e3063559b0
Closes-bug: 1502546

commit_message:
Add utilities for base64

Writing a code using the base64 module (of the Python standard
library) working on Python 2.7 and 3.4 requires many checks on the
input and/or output type:

* base64.b64encode() only accepts byte string: text must be
  explicitly encoded to ASCII
* base64.b64decode() returns bytes: output must be decoded from UTF-8
  when text is expected

This change adds two pairs of encode/decode functions:

* encode_as_bytes(), decode_as_bytes(): always return the result as
  a byte string
* encode_as_text(), decode_as_text(): always return the result as a
  text string

Encode functions accept text: text is encoded to UTF-8 by default,
but the encoding is configurable.

Decode functions accept text: text is decoded from ASCII.

decode_as_text() decodes the result from UTF-8 by default, but again
the encoding is configurable.


The new submodule is called "base64" to be able to replace:

    import base64

with:

    from oslo_serialization import base64

If the base64 module of the stdlib is needed, it can be imported as a
different name. Example:

    import base64 as std_base64


The encoding example:

    if isinstance(text, six.text_type):
       text = text.encode('utf-8')
    text_b64 = base64.b64encode(text)
    text_b64 = text_b64.decode('ascii')

can be replaced with:

    text_b64 = base64.encode_as_text(text)


The decoding example:

    if isinstance(encoded, six.text_type):
       encoded = encoded.decode('ascii')
    text = base64.b64decode(encoded)
    text = text.decode('utf-8')

can be replaced with:

    text = base64.decode_as_text(text)

Change-Id: Icf8df9c947bc0c5f4838508b756ed8f53efd9fc4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.serialization refs/changes/08/229908/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Red Hat # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_serialization import base64 from oslotest import base as test_base class Base64Tests(test_base.BaseTestCase): def test_encode_as_bytes(self): self.assertEqual(base64.encode_as_bytes(b'text'), b'dGV4dA==') self.assertEqual(base64.encode_as_bytes(u'text'), b'dGV4dA==') self.assertEqual(base64.encode_as_bytes(u'e:\xe9'), b'ZTrDqQ==') self.assertEqual(base64.encode_as_bytes(u'e:\xe9', encoding='latin1'), b'ZTrp') def test_encode_as_text(self): self.assertEqual(base64.encode_as_text(b'text'), u'dGV4dA==') self.assertEqual(base64.encode_as_text(u'text'), u'dGV4dA==') self.assertEqual(base64.encode_as_text(u'e:\xe9'), u'ZTrDqQ==') self.assertEqual(base64.encode_as_text(u'e:\xe9', encoding='latin1'), u'ZTrp') def test_decode_as_bytes(self): self.assertEqual(base64.decode_as_bytes(b'dGV4dA=='), b'text') self.assertEqual(base64.decode_as_bytes(u'dGV4dA=='), b'text') def test_decode_as_text(self): self.assertEqual(base64.decode_as_text(b'dGV4dA=='), u'text') self.assertEqual(base64.decode_as_text(u'dGV4dA=='), u'text') self.assertEqual(base64.decode_as_text(u'ZTrDqQ=='), u'e:\xe9') self.assertEqual(base64.decode_as_text(u'ZTrp', encoding='latin1'), u'e:\xe9')

commit_message:
Ensure token validation works irrespective of padding

In change I674bad86ccc9027ac3b365c10b3b142fc9d73c17 we removed the padding from
Fernet tokens. This commit makes it so that we can validate Fernet tokens that
come in with and without padding. This change will only effect Kilo and
Liberty.

Change-Id: Id5d2305b57f29823ef491d7cc9fd541a2d66ea84
Partial-Bug: 1491926
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/22/231022/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import msgpackfrom six.moves import urllib def setUp(self): super(TestTokenFormatter, self).setUp() self.useFixture(ksfixtures.KeyRepository(self.config_fixture)) def test_legacy_padding_validation(self): first_value = uuid.uuid4().hex second_value = uuid.uuid4().hex payload = (first_value, second_value) msgpack_payload = msgpack.packb(payload) # NOTE(lbragstad): This method perserves the way that keystone used to # percent encode the tokens, prior to bug #1491926. def legacy_pack(payload): tf = token_formatters.TokenFormatter() encrypted_payload = tf.crypto.encrypt(payload) # the encrypted_payload is returned with padding appended self.assertTrue(encrypted_payload.endswith('=')) # using urllib.parse.quote will percent encode the padding, like # keystone did in Kilo. percent_encoded_payload = urllib.parse.quote(encrypted_payload) # ensure that the padding was actaully percent encoded self.assertTrue(percent_encoded_payload.endswith('%3D')) return percent_encoded_payload token_with_legacy_padding = legacy_pack(msgpack_payload) tf = token_formatters.TokenFormatter() # demonstrate the we can validate a payload that has been percent # encoded with the Fernet logic that existed in Kilo serialized_payload = tf.unpack(token_with_legacy_padding) returned_payload = msgpack.unpackb(serialized_payload) self.assertEqual(first_value, returned_payload[0]) self.assertEqual(second_value, returned_payload[1])

commit_message:
Fix db_manage to initialize mysql from base

Change the db_manage script to include types when
altering tables and drop constraints before altering tables
because mysql will not allow actions on a table with constraints.

Change-Id: Iafacd662f013cb846bcb3f4ecc50e586e04d55b8
Closes-bug: #1500687
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/18/228718/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _drop_constraint(ctx, name, table): if ctx.dialect.name == 'mysql': # MySQL won't allow some operations with constraints in place op.drop_constraint(name, table, type_='foreignkey') def _create_constraint(ctx, name, tableone, tabletwo, columnone, columntwo): if ctx.dialect.name == 'mysql': # Recreate foreign key constraint op.create_foreign_key(name, tableone, tabletwo, columnone, columntwo) # Need to drop foreign key constraint before mysql will allow changes ctx = op.get_context() _drop_constraint(ctx, 'secrets_project_fk', 'secrets') op.alter_column('secrets', 'project_id', type_=sa.String(36), nullable=False) # Create foreign key constraint again _create_constraint(ctx, 'secrets_project_fk', 'secrets', 'projects', ['project_id'], ['id'])
deleted_lines: op.alter_column('secrets', 'project_id', nullable=False)

commit_message:
The `subtype` formatting arg does not exist

The logging decorator was causing tracebacks due to a nonexistent formatting
argument.

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  [snipped]
KeyError: u'subtype'
Logged from file decorators.py, line 45
```

Change-Id: I9299da8617c7e86a863feb0957f439b90dd60a6a

deleted_lines: LOG.debug(u'%(type) %(method) - %(subtype): %(arguments)', 'method': method, 'arguments': jsonutils.dumps(kwargs)})

subject: Update Project Quotas design spec
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-18 22:38:11.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/quota-support-for-barbican-resources.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican-specs/commit/1765b923da5ae6f7f9c0f0b2d19a03b47d01dea0', 'message': 'Update Project Quotas design spec

Upon discovery and discussion, this commit brings three changes to the
design spec for project quotas.

1) Removal of quota support for transport keys.  It turns out they
   are not a project resource and should not be managed on a per
   project basis.
2) New role for quota management.  The management of project quotas
   can not fall to project level admins.  This must be the responsibility
   of a service level admin.  A new keystone role is introduced to
   implement this change.
3) Clarification of paging support.  The examples are updated to clarify
   the paging support to be implemented for listing project quotas.

Change-Id: I4d5fb76e2868f63f623a8a3cd0b14d0bba31290a
Relates-to: blueprint quota-support-on-barbican-resources
'}]
commit_message:
Update Project Quotas design spec

Upon discovery and discussion, this commit brings three changes to the
design spec for project quotas.

1) Removal of quota support for transport keys.  It turns out they
   are not a project resource and should not be managed on a per
   project basis.
2) New role for quota management.  The management of project quotas
   can not fall to project level admins.  This must be the responsibility
   of a service level admin.  A new keystone role is introduced to
   implement this change.
3) Clarification of paging support.  The examples are updated to clarify
   the paging support to be implemented for listing project quotas.

Change-Id: I4d5fb76e2868f63f623a8a3cd0b14d0bba31290a
Relates-to: blueprint quota-support-on-barbican-resources
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican-specs refs/changes/70/214370/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: be employed to decide if a caller has the required role to perform these operations. Quota management should be under the purview of a service level administrator, not a project level administrator. In the current Barbican implementation, there are four user roles: admin, creator, observer, and auditor. All of these roles are project level. Thus, to accomplish appropriate role based access to for quota a management, a new role will be created. The name of this role will be "key-manager:service-admin".In addition to the four resources specified above, a previous version of this spec described implementing quotas support for transport_keys. This is not possible based on the current implementation of transport_keys, because they are defined per-plugin and not per-project. A project admin should not be managing transport_keys at all. The name of the role required to manage project quotas is decided to be "key-manager:service-admin". This foreshadows a future change where all Barbican roles might be defined with a namespace of key-manager. A variety of other role names ("service-admin", "barbican-admin", "cloud-admin") were are also possible alternatives.other APIs require the caller to have "key-manager:service-admin" role.* List all project quotas (service-admin only) The standard paging support includes adding three fields in the response body, when applicable. * "total": showing the number of project-quotas records * "next": giving a URL to the next page of records * "prev": giving a URL to the previous page of records * GET /v1/project-quotas?limit=x&offset=y (service-admin only) A service-admin user listing all the project quotas ], "total" : 30, } * Example 2:: A service-admin user listing all the project quotas with paging Request: GET /v1/project-quotas?limit=2&offset=6 X-Auth-Token:<token> Response: 200 OK Content-Type: application/json { "project_quotas": [ { "project_id": "1234", "project_quotas": { "secrets": 2000, "orders": 0, "containers": -1, "consumers": null } }, { "project_id": "5678", "project_quotas": { "secrets": 200, "orders": 100, "containers": -1, "consumers": null } }, ], "total" : 30, "next": "http://localhost:9311/v1/project_quotas?limit=2&offset=8", "prev": "http://localhost:9311/v1/project_quotas?limit=2&offset=4" } * Get quotas for a specific project (service-admin only)* Update/Set quotas for a specific project (service-admin only)* Delete quotas for a specific project (service-admin only) For all service-admin-only APIs, the caller is expected to have a barbican key-manager:service-admin role. The check for this will be added to the Barbican policy.json file.Quota commands that only a barbican service-admin can make
deleted_lines: * transport_keys # default number of transport_keys allowed per project quota_transport_keys = -1 be employed to decide if a caller has the required admin role to perform these admin-only operations. The details of this is discussed in a later section below. * transport_keys: Integer, nullable=Trueother APIs require the caller to have admin role. 'transport_keys': {'type':'integer'} "transport_keys": 10,* List all project quotas (admin only) * GET /v1/project-quotas?limit=x&offset=y (Admin only) 'transport_keys': {'type': 'integer'}, An admin user listing all the project quotas "transport_keys": 100, "transport_keys": 0, ] } * Get quotas for a specific project (admin only) 'transport_keys': {'type': 'integer'}, "transport_keys": null,* Update/Set quotas for a specific project (admin only) 'transport_keys': {'type': 'integer'},* Delete quotas for a specific project (admin only) For all admin-only APIs, the caller is expected to have a barbican admin role. The check for this will be added to the Barbican policy.jsonQuota commands that only a barbican admin can make

commit_message:
Spec for vm-integration

This spec covers integration with VM's.

Change-Id: I0c99ad25e11e6fc3c95d68b7ddaaf8a6bfc17860
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican-specs refs/changes/71/159571/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== VM-Integration Spec - VM Integration ========================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/barbican/+spec/vm-integration There needs to be a way to easily get credentials to VM's and allow users to specify what credentials the VM should be able to access. Problem Description =================== As implemented, it is very difficult for a user to use barbican. To do the right thing and be the most secure, each class of VM needs to have its own keystone account. They must also have a tenant per class of VM so that one class of VM can't download the keys of another. Too much permission is also granted to that account. A VM should only ever need Read Only access to the raw data of a secret. Lastly, barbican currently requires a complicated client on the VM to download secrets. Proposed Change =============== With the VM integration feature, barbican will be enhanced to provide the following: * A nova vendor data plugin (Longer term, should be merged into nova). It provides barbican tokens to VM's so they can ask for secrets. * A new middleware for taking a token generated by the vendor data plugin and validating it. * A new api endpoint wrapped in the middleware that proves very easy access to secrets Alternatives ------------ No reasonable solution known. Data model impact ----------------- No data model changes needed. It is simply a new way of accessing the existing data. REST API impact --------------- There is one new api * Specification for the method * Method type: GET * /v1-vm/<container_id|container_name>/<container_secret_name|secret_id> * It returns the data for the secret if found. * If unauthorized or things do not exist, the corresponding http code will be returned. * Example use: The user wants to make a autoscaling template that is a https server. It needs to download ssl certs and other credentials. With the plugin, in place, simple access without anything special installed in the VM can be accomplished with the following snippet: eval $(curl -s 169.254.169.254/openstack/latest/vendor_data.json | python -c 'import sys,json,pipes; j=json.load(sys.stdin);print "\n".join(["%s=%s" %(k.upper(),pipes.quote(j[k])) for k in j if k.startswith("barbican_")])') curl -f -H 'X-Token: '$BARBICAN_TOKEN $BARBICAN_URL/v1-vm/mycontainer/mysecret2 The user adds a security group for their VM that is named the same as a barbican container that contains the keys it needs. The vendor data plugin creates a token that allows the VM access to the security groups the vm is tagged with. Security impact --------------- Yeah, this is a huge change security wise. It should be carefully reviewed. Notifications & Audit Impact ---------------------------- None known. Other end user impact --------------------- No other known impacts. Performance Impact ------------------ It should be called once per secret that needs downloading. Other deployer impact --------------------- To use, the deployer must: * Run barbican-make-trustedkeypair to build the keypair if the package doesn't do it at install. * Get the cert/key to the metadata server and cert to barbican server if they are seperate servers * Create a metadata file in /etc/nova/metadata.json like the following: { "barbican_url" : "https://barbican.foo:9311/", "cloud-init" : "" } * Edit nova.conf section DEFAULT and set: * vendordata_jsonfile_path=/etc/nova/metadata.json * vendordata_driver=barbican.plugin.vendordata_barbican.BarbicanVendorData * Restart the nova metadata server Developer impact ---------------- None known Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: kevpn Work Items ---------- Dependencies ============ Testing ======= Documentation Impact ==================== References ==========

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-02 20:16:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/7e7c642dfd18c0fab891b74387610aea204f8efc', 'message': " Add maas external check for neutron metadata proxy

The neutron metadata agent proxy provides access from within neutron
network namespaces to the neutron metadata agent and thus to the
various sources of metadata provided to instances on 169.254.169.254
at port 80 when cloud-init is used.

The metadata agent has monitoring in RPC but has been reported to be
running but non-responsive on some occasions (see issue #342). The
new check tests the agent's proxy from within the namespace to
monitor responsiveness. Because the agent will use the client host
IP to look for metadata but the request is not originating from an
instance a 404 Not Found response is expected from the agent.

Because local checks are expected to operate from the host rather
than inside a container, and the host does not have ready access to
neutron network namespaces, the monitor must probe for an appropriate
container and resorts to executing a curl request through the network
namespace within the selected container for each network that is
expected to be proxied (only those networks which have ports). This is
deemed easier to verify and understand through command shell
operations than alternative solutions.

This solution seems to work regardless of the value of OSA's
nova_force_config_drive setting or the use of the config-drive feature
in Nova.

backport of https://github.com/rcbops/rpc-openstack/commit/3c598136208610e99e65d2ef495925c4ade209de

commit_message:
Add maas external check for neutron metadata proxy

The neutron metadata agent proxy provides access from within neutron
network namespaces to the neutron metadata agent and thus to the
various sources of metadata provided to instances on 169.254.169.254
at port 80 when cloud-init is used.

The metadata agent has monitoring in RPC but has been reported to be
running but non-responsive on some occasions (see issue #342). The
new check tests the agent's proxy from within the namespace to
monitor responsiveness. Because the agent will use the client host
IP to look for metadata but the request is not originating from an
instance a 404 Not Found response is expected from the agent.

Because local checks are expected to operate from the host rather
than inside a container, and the host does not have ready access to
neutron network namespaces, the monitor must probe for an appropriate
container and resorts to executing a curl request through the network
namespace within the selected container for each network that is
expected to be proxied (only those networks which have ports). This is
deemed easier to verify and understand through command shell
operations than alternative solutions.

This solution seems to work regardless of the value of OSA's
nova_force_config_drive setting or the use of the config-drive feature
in Nova.

backport of https://github.com/rcbops/rpc-openstack/commit/3c598136208610e99e65d2ef495925c4ade209de

Change-Id: Ic85f3f98ce3dfe3295f6710457c64bee6349425d
Closes-Bug: 1502240

added_lines: - include: local_setup.yml vars: check_name: neutron_metadata_agent_proxy_check check_details: file=neutron_metadata_local_check.py,args={{ internal_vip_address }} check_period: "{{ maas_check_period }}" check_timeout: "{{ maas_check_timeout }}" alarms: - { 'name': 'neutron_metadata_agent_proxy_status', 'criteria': ':set consecutiveCount={{ maas_alarm_local_consecutive_count }} if (metric["neutron-metadata-agent-proxy_status"] != 1) { return new AlarmStatus(CRITICAL, "neutron-metadata-agent-proxy non-responsive"); }' } user: root roles: - maas_local

commit_message:
Client: Pass bay_uuid to Service Read/Write API

Add bay_uuid to Service Read/Write API's. This patch makes changes
to the magnum client. Fix to modify API's at controller level
has already been proposed. The API's modified at the contoller
level are update, delete, get_one, detail, get_all. This change
is needed to construct objects from bay.

Change-Id: Ic3c924576cce09b051bc2faa965455b8943216b8
Partially-Implements: bp objects-from-bay

deleted_lines: service = cs.services.update(args.service, patch) cs.services.delete(service) service = cs.services.get(args.service)

commit_message:
Client: Pass bay_uuid to Pod Read/Write API

Add bay_uuid to Pod Read/Write API's. This patch makes changes
to the magnum client. Fix to modify API's at controller level
has already been proposed. The API's modified at the contoller
level are update, delete, get_one, detail, get_all. This change
is needed to construct objects from bay.

Change-Id: I981194e6fbbd0417f63db2b9a53c774199794d25
Partially-Implements: bp objects-from-bay

commit_message:
Client: Pass bay_uuid to RC Read/Write API

Add bay_uuid to Replication Controller Read/Write API's. This patch
makes changes to the magnum client. Fix to modify API's at controller
level has already been proposed. The API's modified at the contoller
level are update, delete, get_one, detail, get_all. This change is
needed to construct objects from bay.

Change-Id: I71bbbdaa0b00aa8657ebf31232846bfe50183aa6
Partially-Implements: bp objects-from-bay

commit_message:
Add --metadata as optional input when do nova image-create

Currently, when using nova image-create, we are not able to
input metadata for the snapshot, and it is always set to be
None.

This patch add --metadata as an optional input when calling
nova image-create.

Change-Id: Ic72dc3652a77cfad099e144423302042a47f6e1e
Closes-bug: #1500727
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/69/228769/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add pep8 check for assertEqual argument order

There is a lot of patches for fixing assertEqual argument order,
and it's not so productive at all. For avoiding creating/reviewing
this kind of patches in the future, this patch adds pep8 check.

black_list which are against this rule are separated to multiple
files because some people are trying to fix this problem on the
gerrit and it is good to avoid merger conflicts for efficient work.
These works are managed on
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/nova-assert-equal-argument-order-fix

Change-Id: I99636b1aba99a5b9343af0c56426775c26ddd679
Depends-on: I01f9caa083dc7d06c850c9f466a6b38fbd42d209
Related-Bug: #1259292

commit_message:
Tag the alembic migration revisions for Liberty

Previously when we had one repo with one alembic branch we would
create a milestone revision on that single branch. Now we have
multiple repos and expand/contract branches for each repo.

So from now on we tag the final revision on every branch when we make
a milestone release. Update the cli to support the command:
  neutron-db-manage upgrade <milestone>
where <milestone> becomes an alias for all the revisions for a
milestone.

Closes-Bug: #1499033

Change-Id: I38623986dd574bec01fe147f9c6a747f3f512bb7
(cherry picked from commit 52236764a3a7c23ec24a86ccb84bc6737e2a4791)
Conflicts:
        neutron/db/migration/cli.py
	neutron/tests/unit/db/test_migration.py

subject: py3: Fix "tox -e py34"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-29 13:17:01.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/workbook/parser.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/test_coordination.py', 'mistral/expressions.py', 'tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/09ccf6fb69212206362c9ecb10f346e0c94bd5a1', 'message': 'py3: Fix "tox -e py34"

Add a py34 test environment to tox.ini which runs a subset of tests
on Python 3.4. When "tox -e py34" will pass, it will become possible
to make the python34 check job voting to avoid Python 3 regressions.
Then slowly more and more tests will be ported to Python 3.

Port also some unit tests to Python 3:

* expressions.py: The message attribute of exceptions has been
  removed in Python 3, use six.text_type(exc) instead.
* test_coordination: fix Unicode versus bytes issues, use byte
  strings for members
* parsers.py: get StringIO from six.

Change-Id: Ib65ed97666919abcfb01a758ed1bcc73b6c0758d
'}]
commit_message:
py3: Fix "tox -e py34"

Add a py34 test environment to tox.ini which runs a subset of tests
on Python 3.4. When "tox -e py34" will pass, it will become possible
to make the python34 check job voting to avoid Python 3 regressions.
Then slowly more and more tests will be ported to Python 3.

Port also some unit tests to Python 3:

* expressions.py: The message attribute of exceptions has been
  removed in Python 3, use six.text_type(exc) instead.
* test_coordination: fix Unicode versus bytes issues, use byte
  strings for members
* parsers.py: get StringIO from six.

Change-Id: Ib65ed97666919abcfb01a758ed1bcc73b6c0758d

commit_message:
Add unit tests for show_server and list_servers

We have a plan to migrate service clients to tempest-lib from Tempest.
However, we are not doing enough tests for service clients now.
This patch adds unit tests for show_server and list_servers.

Change-Id: Ia3deead19f60c2e32201d3ccfab8b6d2070b2a33

failed application deployment for any Heat-based package which
was fixed in python-muranoclient v0.7.1.

subject: Fix quota update in init_instance on nova-compute restart
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-30 06:44:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/68e9359d88646760030a6fe769af122e70986d8c', 'message': "Fix quota update in init_instance on nova-compute restart

During instance deletion if nova-compute crashes after setting
instance vm_state to 'DELETED' but before destroying instance from db,
then on restart of nova-compute _init_instance method deletes instance
from db as well but fails to update quota for that instance.

Since on nova-compute restart that instance was marked as deleted in
db also, quota for that instance never gets updated.

Added code to get instance metadata in init_host as it is required in
'notify_about_instance_usage' method and getting instance
system_metadata before destroying instance from db
in _complete_partial_deletion.

Closes-Bug: 1493694
Change-Id: Ib4ff381848957b33774a4d7c1bfcf1410d67a657
(cherry picked from commit fdd85c10de35c21700dd33bb9b2e0a3ff425d83a)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix quota update in init_instance on nova-compute restart

During instance deletion if nova-compute crashes after setting
instance vm_state to 'DELETED' but before destroying instance from db,
then on restart of nova-compute _init_instance method deletes instance
from db as well but fails to update quota for that instance.

Since on nova-compute restart that instance was marked as deleted in
db also, quota for that instance never gets updated.

Added code to get instance metadata in init_host as it is required in
'notify_about_instance_usage' method and getting instance
system_metadata before destroying instance from db
in _complete_partial_deletion.

Closes-Bug: 1493694
Change-Id: Ib4ff381848957b33774a4d7c1bfcf1410d67a657
(cherry picked from commit fdd85c10de35c21700dd33bb9b2e0a3ff425d83a)

commit_message:
Port common.utils to Python 3

* CooperativeReader: buffer is a byte string, use b'' syntax
  and use bytes() instead of str().
* Don't compare None to int, it raises a TypeError on Python 3.
* Use str[i:i+1] to get a substring from a byte string. On Python 3,
  str[i] now returns an integer for byte strings.
* tox.ini: add glance.tests.unit.common.test_utils to Python 3.4

Change-Id: Ie678555ffd8ac48913f9bf08ac674d1c643bec29

subject: Modify 'render_to_file' function to make it operate on unicode objects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 12:30:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-plugins/commit/464c39867c1812c68d5888ef8bd4d6c2e1f6f277', 'message': "Modify 'render_to_file' function to make it operate on unicode objects

Main issue causes the bug is that values supplied by 'params' dict
may contain unicode objects. And despite the fact template file content
was read into str object, after its processing by template engine unicode
is produced as the result. Hence writing it to the file before explicit
conversion to str encoded with codecs which support non-ascii
characters caused UnicodeEncodeError to occur.

What was done:
* unicode object is constructed from content of the template file just
  after reading of it from the file so that the function is now
  operate only on unicode entities. Decoding is done using 'utf-8'
  encoding which should prevent from errors when the content contains
  non-ascii characters;
* decoding result of the function's operations to string in 'utf-8'
  encoding before writing it to a file;
* unit test for the functions is added. It checks whether written value
  could be decoded to expected unicode object using 'utf-8' encoding

Change-Id: I73ee352a439d7a9d5c71033f31530a0ced68324c
Closes-Bug: #1475234
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-23 09:12:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-plugins/commit/c4c75e821f209ea23d52e444097a341266c5fd86', 'message': "Modify 'render_to_file' function to make it operate on unicode objects

If we have non-ascii chars in rendered template we might end up with
UnicodeDecodeError exception when writing the content to a file. To
eliminate this issue io.open is used with additional 'encoding'
parameter

commit_message:
Modify 'render_to_file' function to make it operate on unicode objects

If we have non-ascii chars in rendered template we might end up with
UnicodeDecodeError exception when writing the content to a file. To
eliminate this issue io.open is used with additional 'encoding'
parameter

Change-Id: I73ee352a439d7a9d5c71033f31530a0ced68324c
Closes-Bug: #1475234

deleted_lines: template_file = f.read()

commit_message:
/common/utils.py py34 incompatibility

Fixes bug found during unit test of get_random_string() method.
For Python3 it is required to encode string as bytes object
before hashing.

Related-blueprint: neutron-python3
Closes-bug: #1502148
Change-Id: I93061a831b45fc8b3ede0211af665ce02f36f38a
(cherry picked from commit 3d54459c2971f01581354c8a6b9c58abea7743d8)

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 OpenStack Foundation. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os.path import tempfile import mock from neutron.common import utils from neutron.tests import base class TestReplaceFile(base.BaseTestCase): def test_replace_file(self): self.file_name = "new_file" data = "data to copy" utils.replace_file(self.file_name, data) with open(self.file_name) as f: content = f.read() self.assertEqual(content, data) class TestReadCachedFile(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): base.BaseTestCase.setUp(self) self.cached_file = tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(delete=False) with open(self.cached_file.name, 'w') as f: f.write('epol') def test_read_cached_file_from_cache(self): cache_info = {'mtime': os.path.getmtime(self.cached_file.name), 'data': 'ericpol'} utils.read_cached_file(self.cached_file.name, cache_info) self.assertEqual('ericpol', cache_info['data']) def test_read_cached_file_no_reload_func(self): cache_info = {'mtime': 1} utils.read_cached_file(self.cached_file.name, cache_info) self.assertEqual('epol', cache_info['data']) def test_read_cached_file_with_reload_func(self): cache_info = {'mtime': 1} reload_func = mock.Mock() utils.read_cached_file(self.cached_file.name, cache_info, reload_func) self.assertEqual('epol', cache_info['data']) reload_func.assert_called_once_with('epol') class TestFindConfigFile(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): base.BaseTestCase.setUp(self) self.config_file_1 = tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile() self.config_file_2 = tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile() home_path = os.path.abspath(os.path.expanduser('~')) self.plugin_path = os.path.join(home_path, 'neutron', 'plugins', 'ericpol') os.makedirs(self.plugin_path) self.config_file_plugin = os.path.join(self.plugin_path, os.path.basename(self.config_file_2.name)) self.config_file_home = os.path.join(home_path, os.path.basename(self.config_file_2.name)) def test_find_config_file_from_options(self): options = {"config_file": self.config_file_1.name} self.assertEqual(options["config_file"], utils.find_config_file(options, self.config_file_2.name)) def test_find_config_file_from_home(self): os.rename(self.config_file_2.name, self.config_file_home) options = {} config_file = os.path.basename(self.config_file_home) self.assertEqual(self.config_file_home, utils.find_config_file(options, config_file)) def test_find_config_file_from_plugin(self): os.remove(self.config_file_1.name) os.rename(self.config_file_2.name, self.config_file_plugin) options = {"config_file": self.config_file_1.name, "plugin": "ericpol"} config_file = os.path.basename(self.config_file_plugin) self.assertEqual(self.config_file_plugin, utils.find_config_file(options, config_file)) def test_find_config_file_not_found(self): os.remove(self.config_file_1.name) os.remove(self.config_file_2.name) options = {"config_file": self.config_file_1.name} config_file = os.path.basename(self.config_file_2.name) self.assertIsNone(utils.find_config_file(options, config_file))

commit_message:
Port store image to Python 3

* StoreLocations: add a __eq__() method, Python 3 doesn't use __cmp__()
  anymore
* Fix StoreLocations.__delitem__(): Python 3 now calls it with a slice
  for "del locations[a:b]" instead of calling __delslice__().
* Fix test_store_location: mark byte strinsg with b'...' prefix.
* tox.ini: add test_store_location to Python 3.4

Change-Id: Ibe8dac3d442ee08ae6b347e256947b6b9c5224ae

commit_message:
Port replicator to Python 3

* replication_dump(): explicit the JSON encoding (UTF-8) to not rely on
  the locale encoding, otherwise the function will fail on non-ASCII
  character if the locale encoding is ASCII (ex: POSIX locale aka "C")
* Use sorted() to get the sorted list of keys. dict.keys() returns a
  generator on Python 3 which has no sort() method.
* Fix FakeImageService: HTTP body is bytes
* utils.py: get the urllib module from six.moves
* tox.ini: add test_glance_replicator to Python 3.4

Change-Id: Iaded283c70f49abb2408565563c173f58fff2fc7

Fix way to create login_url in dashboard test

This change can create the right login_url even if dashboard_url is
not root.

commit_message:
Improve readability of dockerfiles and cleanup

* Added newlines to long RUN commands in dockerfiles.
* Removed storage-* containers (obsolete since 6.0)
* Removed shotgun workaround in mcollective container.
* Cleaned up duplicate packages already included in
  fuel/centos base container.
* Moved hiera default yaml workaround to fuel/centos

Change-Id: I1ed33c6df5a5dcac2c0861e08d36184d9a8c2c2d
Closes-Bug: #1482232

commit_message:
Implement get_boot_device for seamicro driver

Implement get_boot_device for seamicro driver to get current boot
device for the task's node and its persistent state, whether the
boot device will persist to all future boots or not.

Change-Id: I49d0e45d56d9ceb373fc430ff184f963b6275ca2
Closes-bug: 1407888

server.get_boot_order = fake_get_boot_order mock_get_server.return_value = server with task_manager.acquire(self.context, self.info['uuid'], shared=False) as task: expected_response = {'boot_device': boot_devices.PXE, 'persistent': True} self.assertEqual(expected_response, mock_get_server.assert_called_once_with(self.info) @mock.patch.object(seamicro, '_get_server') def test_get_boot_device_hd0(self, mock_get_server): def fake_get_boot_order(): return 200, "hd0" server = self.Server(active="true") server.get_boot_order = fake_get_boot_order mock_get_server.return_value = server with task_manager.acquire(self.context, self.info['uuid'], shared=False) as task: expected_response = {'boot_device': boot_devices.DISK, 'persistent': True} self.assertEqual(expected_response, task.driver.management.get_boot_device(task)) mock_get_server.assert_called_once_with(self.info) @mock.patch.object(seamicro, '_get_server') def test_management_interface_get_boot_device_unknown_dev(self, mock_get_server): def fake_get_boot_order(): return 200, "Fake" server = self.Server(active="true") server.get_boot_order = fake_get_boot_order mock_get_server.return_value = server with task_manager.acquire(self.context, self.node.uuid, shared=False) as task: response = task.driver.management.get_boot_device(task) self.assertIsNone(response['boot_device']) mock_get_server.assert_called_once_with(self.info) @mock.patch.object(seamicro, '_get_server') def test_management_interface_get_boot_device_fail(self, commit_message:
Change ironic-python-agent release model

Historically, ironic-python-agent has always recommended deploying from
master branch. However, we realize that actual releases and stable
branches bring value to some folks. So, this commit:

* makes IPA managed by the release team
* makes IPA do intermediary releases with a coordinated cycle release
* makes IPA do stable branches

Change-Id: I04a8242692831a054430f763414c3a38cba46617
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/83/229983/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: - release:independent

commit_message:
Stop setting DIB_EXTLINUX for vanilla/centos7

Remove the setting of DIB_EXTLINUX for vanilla/centos7, as it now builds
fine with recent diskimage-builder versions.

This partially reverts commit 53627f187b94c7355ff0640d68b323790536475d
(the other half of it has already been reverted with commit
2fb3c7e2e86beff2db60bb3bd3c10d7eb547f151).

Change-Id: Ib5b72c7b4e40466ffd59e321c8a59dc7a41b0306

In preparation for the release, do some cleanups for translations.

Removes all po files that are partially translated. The translation
team has decided to exclude files with less than 66 % of translated
content. There is no content lost, all data is in the translation
server, we just remove it from the repository.

commit_message:
Cleanup of Translations

In preparation for the release, do some cleanups for translations.

Removes all po files that are partially translated. The translation
team has decided to exclude files with less than 66 % of translated
content. There is no content lost, all data is in the translation
server, we just remove it from the repository.

This updates also recreates pot (translation source files) to
reflect the state of the repository in case there was no recent
import for them.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle some of these cases.

Change-Id: I9616eb5e756f694b55cadb57b7b2aacf46833bb9

commit_message:
Functional tests: optionally skip admin actions in setups

* This defaults to doing those admin actions
* This lets us run a set of smoke tests without need admin access
* Fix a url to respect the `append_version_to_url` config option
* Also, move configs like this into a separate config section

Change-Id: If159423906d979990264fd8fd47b47e37aafe6ed

commit_message:
Improve password quality for generated passwords

This change increases the default length of passwords generated by
nailgun from 8 to 24.

Change-Id: I3ef3f9008ea350f5bf8ddc00cc7a706eab1d899b
Closes-Bug: #1501743

commit_message:
Allow releasing fuel-dev-tools to PyPi

fuel-dev-tools is a useful package for ones who are
testing something on a live Fuel environment or troublesooting
a problem. In order to make it more useful, it's necessary
to publish it on PyPi.

This patch adds publish-to-pypi template to fuel-dev-tools
project.

Change-Id: I56916bac4fc3aee2247ee2337836cb128cd3c018
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/74/216174/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: publish-to-pypi

commit_message:
Clean up instance specific informantion on tear down

After sucessfully tearing down a node some information about the previous
instance are still shown to the user. Things like the root UUID of the
last image's filesystem and whether it was a full disk image or not. Those
information should be cleaned up.

Apparently only the PXE driver was leaving such informations.

Closes-Bug: #1451885
Change-Id: Ice9926bbbb93d2ecf8ac1c70fcd78b7e8b76bf22
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/20/180220/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: task.node.driver_internal_info = {'is_whole_disk_image': 'fake', 'root_uuid_or_disk_id': 'fake'} # Assert instance spefic information is not present self.assertNotIn('is_whole_disk_image', task.node.driver_internal_info) self.assertNotIn('root_uuid_or_disk_id', task.node.driver_internal_info)

commit_message:
Change remote logging configuration condition

We'll have new 'enabled' meta parameter in 'syslog' hash. So it
would be better to use it in remote logging conditions.

Requires: I0190c202a72f432c23c71b9ebea88bc01476d2ee

Change-Id: Id4b8cd47bd27bbc7224a3258b5b5388b89496e35
Partial-bug: #1418848

subject: (WIP)Add user/project information to Ceilometer Event Model
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-29 10:39:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/ad5ba72d11639db8d97e294e6eca65fa67f1855e', 'message': '(WIP)Add user/project information to Ceilometer Event Model

The current Event object schema does not define user or
project information related to an event. Due to this
ownership information related to an event can never be
established. This interferes with applying Role Based
Access Control related rules on an Event (basically
means that rules cannot be defined in the policy.json).
Associating user/project information with an Event might
not be too significant a requirement when it comes to
common events, but this becomes a critical need when it
comes to audit-related events.

Partially Closes-Bug: 1461767

Change-Id: I108acdff6ef4b8ea4733debef666b46559a42682
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-29 12:02:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/30edf4745a4142f0da88d834161ce176b0eaa68c', 'message': '(WIP)Add user/project information to Ceilometer Event Model

commit_message:
(WIP)Add user/project information to Ceilometer Event Model

The current Event object schema does not define user or
project information related to an event. Due to this
ownership information related to an event can never be
established. This interferes with applying Role Based
Access Control related rules on an Event (basically
means that rules cannot be defined in the policy.json).
Associating user/project information with an Event might
not be too significant a requirement when it comes to
common events, but this becomes a critical need when it
comes to audit-related events.

Partially Closes-Bug: 1461767

Change-Id: I108acdff6ef4b8ea4733debef666b46559a42682

commit_message:
file backend: do not inherit from glance::api

Do not make ::glance::backend::file inherits from ::glance::api because
::glance::api has parameters.
The class was broken until now.

Also, we need to include glance::backend::file to have
'filesystem_store_datadir' parameter in Glance config, since we're using
file backend.

If you don't provide this parameter, Glance fails to start:
glance_store._drivers.filesystem [-] Specify at least
'filesystem_store_datadir' or 'filesystem_store_datadirs' option

Change-Id: Iba6791199f7a2c7fef24b1e8752ed0b564b8512f

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

At some places, corrected argument order for assertNotEqual method as well
and replaced assertEqual with assertTrue wherever required.

Partial-Bug: #1259292

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

At some places, corrected argument order for assertNotEqual method as well
and replaced assertEqual with assertTrue/assertFalse wherever required. Also
renamed params passed to assertEqual method to avoid confusion for developers.

Partial-Bug: #1259292

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

At some places, corrected argument order for assertNotEqual method as well.

Partial-Bug: #1259292
Change-Id: I8af6135a466d03cd1b19e2334389cfdfd0b24120

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

At some places, corrected argument order for assertNotEqual method as well.

Closes-Bug: #1259292
Change-Id: Ifed4fd9812313c8fddaad97fd46f59c035ca5d03

This plugin is far enough along that as of the Mitaka release cycle, I'd
like to start doing releases in line with the OpenStack release cycle so
that this plugin does releases at the same time as the core of Neutron.

Change-Id: I6e83106319135ebfc88fb3fd59e54be6b4db4a6b
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Change release model for networking-ovn

This plugin is far enough along that as of the Mitaka release cycle, I'd
like to start doing releases in line with the OpenStack release cycle so
that this plugin does releases at the same time as the core of Neutron.

Change-Id: I6e83106319135ebfc88fb3fd59e54be6b4db4a6b
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/61/228461/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - release:cycle-with-milestones
deleted_lines: - release:independent

subject: Setup error check & minor bug fix in CloudByte
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-01 10:37:18.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/cloudbyte/cloudbyte.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_cloudbyte.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/6feefe70ce4b9f0c01543fc71c944addf4ab6eb1', 'message': 'Setup error check & minor bug fix in CloudByte

Currently in CloudByte Cinder driver there is now way of checking
the "absence" or "validity" of configuration parameters, which are
configured by clients during DevStack setup against CloudByte
Storage in "cinder.conf". In this case the cinder-volume service
initializes the driver with the parameters either not present or are
invalid, and due to this several ambiguity happens at client-end, like:

* Volume related operation failure.
* No proper detection of the cause of failure.

So, to rectify this problem "check_for_setup_error" method is added
which will check the absence and validity of config parameters and
will not initialize the driver until the cause is rectified.

Also, another minor bug fixed is done which allows the volume
deletion operation to continue from OpenStack even if the volume has
been deleted from CloudByte Storage.

Change-Id: Ia23aac3ecf7f706ab39ddef51fb5494df6d4d0dd
Closes-Bug: #1501304
'}]
commit_message:
Setup error check & minor bug fix in CloudByte

Currently in CloudByte Cinder driver there is now way of checking
the "absence" or "validity" of configuration parameters, which are
configured by clients during DevStack setup against CloudByte
Storage in "cinder.conf". In this case the cinder-volume service
initializes the driver with the parameters either not present or are
invalid, and due to this several ambiguity happens at client-end, like:

* Volume related operation failure.
* No proper detection of the cause of failure.

So, to rectify this problem "check_for_setup_error" method is added
which will check the absence and validity of config parameters and
will not initialize the driver until the cause is rectified.

Also, another minor bug fixed is done which allows the volume
deletion operation to continue from OpenStack even if the volume has
been deleted from CloudByte Storage.

Change-Id: Ia23aac3ecf7f706ab39ddef51fb5494df6d4d0dd
Closes-Bug: #1501304
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/14/229814/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
workload: fix custom_image cleanup

A VM ran by `custom_image` context is left running in case the script
failed. Fix this by moving cleanup to a try/finally block letting
the exception propagate upwards so no scenario is run when the context
have failed.

Change-Id: I90d783eeb50b1f0bfa77d59993ff116451d11878
Closes-Bug: #1502832

subject: Create service_default function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-16 16:33:37.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/parser/functions/service_default.rb', 'spec/functions/service_default_spec.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/commit/217162e8581a15f8e0dcffcb3cd58373547e8439', 'message': "Create service_default function

This change creates a parser function that can be used in place of the
string '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' for class parameters or anywhere someone
would want to specify the string within puppet code.

Things like:
 class openstack::class (
    $param_user = '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
    $param_pass = '<SERVICE DEFAULT>') { ... }

Can be replaced with:
  class openstack::class (
    $param_user = service_default(),
    $param_pass = service_default()) { ...  }

Leveraging this function instead of the constant use '<SERVICE DEFAULT>'
allows for easy refactoring and reduces the posibility for typos to make
it past reviews. Ideally it would be awesome if we could create our own
custom puppet reserved word or a constant but since you cannot do this,
a parser function allows for similar functionality.

Change-Id: Ic0665485d855225aaa522074e4505d704b0c513b
"}]
commit_message:
Create service_default function

This change creates a parser function that can be used in place of the
string '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' for class parameters or anywhere someone
would want to specify the string within puppet code.

Things like:
 class openstack::class (
    $param_user = '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
    $param_pass = '<SERVICE DEFAULT>') { ... }

Can be replaced with:
  class openstack::class (
    $param_user = service_default(),
    $param_pass = service_default()) { ...  }

Leveraging this function instead of the constant use '<SERVICE DEFAULT>'
allows for easy refactoring and reduces the posibility for typos to make
it past reviews. Ideally it would be awesome if we could create our own
custom puppet reserved word or a constant but since you cannot do this,
a parser function allows for similar functionality.

Change-Id: Ic0665485d855225aaa522074e4505d704b0c513b

commit_message:
Add os_service_default fact

This change adds a custom fact called os_service_default, for use with
the openstack modules to provide the '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' string for
configurations.

Static external facts can be loaded from <MODULEPATH>/<MODULE>/facts.d/
starting with Puppet 3.4/Facter 2.0.1. Prior to this change, the static
facts needed to be placed in an environment specific location. For
Facter < 2.0.1, we are providing a regular ruby fact.

Change-Id: Id6eec6f96d545bb0054aad30bf359cf32521c83a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib refs/changes/50/229050/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # This adds the service_default fact for people with facter < 2.0 # For people with facter >= 2.0, the facts.d/services_default.txt should # provide this information # require 'puppet/util/package' if Puppet::Util::Package.versioncmp(Facter.value(:facterversion), '2.0.1') < 0 Facter.add('service_default') do setcode do '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' end end end

commit_message:
Just call set-manager if connecting fails

Instead of calling set-manager every init, only call it when
getting the schema fails inside of Connection.start() which is
only called once.

Closes-Bug: #1499784
Change-Id: Ib28cd912e1f2eba318a6b0a82269919a1c95312d
(cherry picked from commit c561c7c20acef7227e2eab2be30a2626e16d2354)

deleted_lines: helper = idlutils.get_schema_helper(self.connection, self.schema_name)

commit_message:
Live HTML builds for documentation edits

Editing documentation and running 'make html' after each edit can be tedious.
This patch adds automatic build support that will watch the docs directories
for any changes, and then build documentation when changes are saved to disk.

The writer can then refresh their browser and see the latest content without
needing to run 'make html' after each edit.

Closes-Bug: 1500897

Change-Id: I29a36d29a7eef85bb275fe1a474b51aa97e7990e

commit_message:
Add Router-Advertisements to inbound icmp-types

VMs were able to issue ICMP Router Solicitations requests but answers
were always blocked. Users had to manually create rules in
security-groups to receive a default route.

This commit allows inbound router-advertisements by default.

Change-Id: Ieae04fc43300e6a0a84942534e75173f3ae24a2f

commit_message:
Port glance.db to Python 3

* add(), save(): don't compare None to an integer, it raises a TypeError
  on Python 3.
* _pop_task_info_values(): copy values items because the values
  dictionary is modified in the loop body.
* replace filter() with a list-comprehension: filter() returns a
  generator on Python 3 which has no length.
* tox.ini: add test_db and test_quota unit tests to Python 3.4

Change-Id: I1494e81b154fc64df814b5f96c15fe032bb5057b

commit_message:
Port image cache to Python 3

* Use bytes for image content
* On Python 3, set_xattr() encodes the text value to UTF-8
* Open files in binary mode, not in text mode
* get_caching_iter(): pass a list as the image iterator, not a string.
  On Python 3, list(b'abc') returns [97, 98, 99], whereas Python 2 returns
  ['a', 'b', 'c'].
* tox.ini: add glance.tests.unit.test_image_cache to Python 3.4

Change-Id: I638525d19c42990852cf45dd416318d9a847c303

commit_message:
Fix Python 3 issues in glance.tests.unit.common

* Open file in text mode to write a paste configuration file, don't open
  in binary mode
* Replace dict.keys()[0] with list(dict.keys())[0], dict.keys() now
  returns an iterator on Python 3
* Replace xrange() with range()
* tox.ini: add the following glance.tests.unit.common tests to Python
  3.4:

  - test_config
  - test_exception
  - test_semver

Change-Id: Ibcfd106cad985b5e08f1e821b3b60a4d0d0911be

commit_message:
Use the correct filter key in reset_stack_status

The key 'status' would have been ignored, so we were retrieving too many
records from the database and processing them in-memory (although they were
porcessed correctly).

Change-Id: Iea448b518d4e9e73f21b029d0fd9e92ecf9e4831
Closes-Bug: #1501827

deleted_lines: filters = {'status': parser.Stack.IN_PROGRESS}

commit_message:
Fixes 'ovs-agent cannot start on Windows because root_helper opt is not found'

Change Ie1224f8a1c17268cd7d1c474ed82fdfb8852eaa8 removed
config.register_root_helper() from ovs_neutron_agent:main, thus the agent
cannot start on Windows since root_helper config option is never
registered.

The fix consists in adding config.register_root_helper in the Windows side
utils.

Closes-Bug: #1497930

Change-Id: I6adc3b869c9564cac3ab99174b8fe47584213e59
(cherry picked from commit 074f82d3ec18fd591e9d1805676dfe13bd508510)

"/ping?agents=%d" % agents).json() except requests.exceptions.RequestException: LOG.debug("MasterAgent %s is down." % http_url) return "DOWN" LOG.debug("%d agents is up through %s." % (len(pings), http_url)) return "UP %d" % len(pings) @atomic.action_timer("vm.wait_for_agent_ping") def _wait_for_agent_ping(self, http_url, expected_agents): utils.wait_for( (http_url, expected_agents), is_ready=utils.resource_is("UP %d" % expected_agents, self._ping_agent), timeout=CONF.benchmark.vm_agent_ping_timeout, check_interval=CONF.benchmark.vm_agent_ping_poll_interval ) def _agent_run_command_wait(self, http_url, agents, command, expected_runtime, can_run_off): LOG.debug("Running command %r on %d agent(s) via %s" % ( command, agents, http_url)) commands = requests.post(http_url + "/command?agents=%d" % agents, data=command, ).json() LOG.debug("Commands %r started on %s" % (commands, http_url)) if expected_runtime is not None: time.sleep(expected_runtime) run = { "stdout": collections.defaultdict(tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile), "stderr": collections.defaultdict(tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile), "exit_code": {} } while True: tails = requests.post(http_url + "/tail?agents=%d" % agents).json() LOG.debug("Tailed %r" % tails) updated = False for tail in tails: agent = tail["agent"] for fd in "stdout", "stderr": if tail[fd]: run[fd][agent].write(tail[fd]) updated = True if not updated: checks = requests.post( http_url + "/check?agents=%d" % agents ).json() LOG.debug("Checking %r" % checks) finished = 0 for check in checks: if check["exit_code"] is not None: finished += 1 run["exit_code"][check["agent"]] = check["exit_code"] if finished >= agents - can_run_off: break return run def _agent_run_command(self, command_with_args, servers_with_ips, expected_runtime=None, can_run_off=0): fip = servers_with_ips[0][1] http_url = "http://%s:8080" % fip["ip"] agents = len(servers_with_ips) self._wait_for_agent_ping(http_url, agents) # TODO(pboldin): Should do better job moving requests out of this env = ["FIXED_IP%d=%s" % (i, d[2]) for i, d in enumerate(servers_with_ips)] env.append("AGENT_ID=None") if not isinstance(command_with_args, list): command_with_args = [command_with_args] command = { "path": command_with_args, "thread": "true", "env": env } return self._agent_run_command_wait( http_url, agents, command, expected_runtime, can_run_off) def _process_agent_commands_output(self, reduction_command, run_result): stdin = json.dumps(run_result, default=default_serialize) LOG.debug("Dumping %s into stdin." % stdin) process = subprocess.Popen( reduction_command, stdin=subprocess.PIPE, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE) stdout, stderr = process.communicate(stdin) LOG.debug("Got STDOUT:

%s

Got STDERR

%s

" % (stdout, stderr)) return json.loads(stdout)
deleted_lines: help="Time to wait for a VM to become pingable")]

commit_message:
Small optimization in Block Device driver

Method _devices_sizes() in Block Device driver invokes N times
_get_device_size(device) to get devices sizes. It can be done by
executing one command: blockdev --getsize64 /dev/loop1 /dev/loop2.
In such a way we take the devices' sizes in bytes and convert them
to Megabytes.

Change-Id: I0aba86239b4c580a0b12202a8f7fc863dab6fecd

commit_message:
Enforce project ownership of subCAs

The add-to-project and create CA commands can only be performed by
a project administrator when the target CA is either a root CA
or a subCA owned by the admin's project.

This CR adds checks to enforce this condition.

Change-Id: Ifbd7bb471b137a5549a8e627344f8f02adda2ed1
Closes-bug: #1501862
(cherry picked from commit 8bbf06caae29c1cafa16f4ed8db83938b9cf94f3)

commit_message:
Check a CA's status as project and preferred CA before deleting

If a CA is preferred and not the last CA of a project, it should
not be deleted.  A user is informed of this with a 409 status code.

Otherwise, the CA can be deleted as well as any record of it in the
CA project list and the CA preferred list.

Change-Id: I9a1ee91252ee17746cfcffd11cba520270d09f21
Closes-bug: #1499876
(cherry picked from commit 4afaee095a78cbc473278ac42bb2f9de949af0a8)

commit_message:
Add missing function '_validate_limit'

The function '_validate_limit' in api/v2/metadef_objects.py is
missing.

This patch added it.

Change-Id: I8171b329fc4180de96ddb7aedbc2f23498c0b265
Closes-bug: #1495346
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/57/222957/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _validate_limit(self, limit): try: limit = int(limit) except ValueError: msg = _("limit param must be an integer") raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg) if limit <= 0: msg = _("limit param must be positive") raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg) return limit

commit_message:
Add subca functionality to the dogtag plugin

The Dogtag CA plugin has been modified to support
subordinate CAs.  This includes updating the list of
CAs read from the CA when the the ca list is refreshed.

Unit tests for the Dogtag CA have been updated, and functional
tests have been added for the Dogtag CA for subca creation.

Also added some exceptions to convey issues in subca creation
and deletion.

Closes-Bug: #1502320
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-cas
Change-Id: I1766cb4a2069ea56d386067c9aa2811a50410a9d
(cherry picked from commit be40fa7d0393cb30b4c03ce7ee4dcb6c990761a9)

commit_message:
Use default gw in admin network for deployment

Set default gw in admin network for isolated deployment of controller, if
defined, otherwise set default gw to master node's ip address.

Change-Id: I0adb9e3b78c29d5fb32ccd60e078fd0fff352647
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/03/229303/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from octane.helpers import transformations as ts def test_reset_gw_admin(mocker): host_config = DEPLOYMENT_INFO gateway = '10.10.10.10' res = ts.reset_gw_admin(host_config, gateway) assert res['network_scheme']['endpoints']['br-fw-admin']['gateway'] == \ gateway def test_get_network_gw(mocker): net_name = 'test_net' gateway = '10.10.10.10' data = { 'networks': [ { 'name': net_name, 'gateway': gateway } ] } res = ts.get_network_gw(data, net_name) assert res == gateway def test_get_network_gw_no_gw(mocker): net_name = 'test_net' data = { 'networks': [{ 'name': net_name, }] } res = ts.get_network_gw(data, net_name) assert res is None def test_get_network_gw_no_net(mocker): net_name = 'test_net' data = { 'networks': [{ 'name': 'another_test_net', 'gateway': '10.10.10.10' }] } res = ts.get_network_gw(data, net_name) assert res is None DEPLOYMENT_INFO = { 'network_scheme': { 'endpoints': { 'br-ex': {'gateway': '172.16.0.1', }, 'br-fw-admin': {} } } }

'}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2015-08-20 09:19:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet/commit/9457b53b0de69836fb0ca21774521424f86a0d94', 'message': 'MidoNet FWaaS plugin

MidoNet support for FWaaS.  This patch includes the following:

 * MidoNet FWaaS plugin and its implementation
 * Unit tests for FWaaS MidoNet plugin
 * requirements.txt update
 * devstack support for FWaaS

FWaaS is implemented by having MidonetFirewallDriver set as the RPC API
client. This driver does not actually do any RPC, but simply proxies
the API calls to the MidoNet side.  This design was chosen instead of
implementing the FWaaS plugin methods because these methods get as
input more complete data on the firewall object, including its rules
and the routers associated/disassociated.  The downside is that each

commit_message:
MidoNet FWaaS plugin

MidoNet support for FWaaS.  This patch includes the following:

 * MidoNet FWaaS plugin and its implementation
 * Unit tests for FWaaS MidoNet plugin
 * requirements.txt update

FWaaS is implemented by having MidonetFirewallDriver set as the RPC API
client. This driver does not actually do any RPC, but simply proxies
the API calls to the MidoNet side.  This design was chosen instead of
implementing the FWaaS plugin methods because these methods get as
input more complete data on the firewall object, including its rules
and the routers associated/disassociated.  The downside is that each
request might get bloated unnecessarily.  We will revisit the design
when such problem arises.

Change-Id: Ie8283eb17c12960e0190da1bf9acc86916ca51b0
Signed-off-by: Ryu Ishimoto <ryu@midokura.com>
Implements: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/networking-midonet/+spec/midonet-fwaas
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/44/210844/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (C) 2015 Midokura SARL # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from midonet.neutron.common import config # noqa from neutron import i18n from neutron_fwaas.db.firewall import firewall_db from neutron_fwaas.services.firewall import fwaas_plugin as fw_plugin from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_utils import excutils from oslo_utils import importutils LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) _LE = i18n._LE _LW = i18n._LW class MidonetFirewallDriver(object): """FWaaS driver for MidoNet that implements the RPC API The driver does not actually do any RPC, but simply proxies the API calls to the MidoNet side. This design was chosen instead of implementing the FWaaS plugin methods because these methods conveniently get as input the firewall object wit h rules, and useful router association information. .""" def __init__(self, client): self.client = client def create_firewall(self, context, firewall): self.client.create_firewall(context, firewall) def update_firewall(self, context, firewall): self.client.update_firewall(context, firewall) def delete_firewall(self, context, firewall): self.client.delete_firewall(context, firewall) class MidonetFirewallPlugin(fw_plugin.FirewallPlugin): """Implementation of the Neutron Firewall Service Plugin. This class manages the workflow of FWaaS request/response. DB related updates, including router insertion logics, are handled by fw_plugin.FirewallPlugin. """ def __init__(self): """Override initialization to avoid any RPC setup. Instead, set the rpc handling to the MidonetFirewallDriver class so that it handles the FWaaS update events.""" self._load_client() self.agent_rpc = MidonetFirewallDriver(self.client) firewall_db.subscribe() def _load_client(self): try: self.client = importutils.import_object(cfg.CONF.MIDONET.client) LOG.debug("Loaded midonet client '%(client)s'", {'client': self.client}) except ImportError: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.exception(_LE("Error loading midonet client '%(client)s'"), {'client': self.client})

commit_message:
Make ssh user configurable

The ssh user used to configure keystone on the overcloud shouldn't be
hardcoded. Make the user read from a cli arg instead, defaulting to the
expected value of heat-admin.

Change-Id: I99865e8225ff3b9ab56710756e14783dfd1ea0f0

commit_message:
Use format to convert ints to strings

This ensures that on 32bit architectures, where
sometimes an implicit long is created, the resulting
string does not contain a 'L' suffix as generated
by the hex function.

Change-Id: I264f90d68009963fe7a217c2170e1cf2f46ae2bb
Closes-Bug: 1501703
(cherry picked from commit 49883f1b2bfc9a4f06b1d336553d7f0ab4289a0d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/23/230523/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return '{0:#x}/{1:#x}'.format(*integers)
deleted_lines: return '/'.join(map(hex, integers))

generatinon of result archive name in case when user create package
from classes directory. This patch fixes this issue

commit_message:
libvirt: check if ImageMeta.disk_format is set before accessing it

Commit 4f43bbafa4bfc2ab149d5db4eb55320c1602658b changed
blockinfo.get_root_info to access the disk_format attribute on the
passed in image_meta (ImageMeta object) like an object, but if that
attribute is not set you'll get an error.

image_meta can be an empty object in the case of evacuate where
image_ref is passed as None to the compute manager's rebuild_instance
method in the case of evacuate, so image_meta defaults to {}. So when
the ImageMeta object is created in LibvirtDriver.spawn, there is nothing
in it.

We have to check if the attribute is set before accessing it using
obj_attr_is_set because the ImageMeta class does not include the
NovaObjectDictCompat mixin, so we can't use
image_meta.get('disk_format').

Closes-Bug: #1501831

Change-Id: I95e543415b881603bb997ae0e159017c03e58a53
(cherry picked from commit 2b1a2bc034e371a9f6d95f48ed8fa77e0854d675)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/57/230657/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('nova.virt.libvirt.blockinfo.find_disk_dev_for_disk_bus', return_value='vda') @mock.patch('nova.virt.libvirt.blockinfo.get_disk_bus_for_disk_dev', return_value='virtio') def test_get_root_info_no_bdm_empty_image_meta(self, mock_get_bus, mock_find_dev): # The evacuate operation passes image_ref=None to the compute node for # rebuild which then defaults image_meta to {}, so we don't have any # attributes in the ImageMeta object passed to get_root_info and we # need to make sure we don't try lazy-loading anything. instance = objects.Instance(**self.test_instance) image_meta = objects.ImageMeta.from_dict({}) blockinfo.get_root_info(instance, 'kvm', image_meta, None, 'virtio', 'ide') mock_find_dev.assert_called_once_with({}, 'virtio') blockinfo.get_root_info(instance, 'kvm', image_meta, None, 'virtio', 'ide', root_device_name='/dev/vda') mock_get_bus.assert_called_once_with('kvm', '/dev/vda')

commit_message:
Make use of config options for indexer plugins

Enables per-plugin config sections to defined index_name, enabled,
topics for notifications.

Co-Authored-By: Steve McLellan <steven.j.mclellan@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I82a116ff8b5c86111603972e5096dc1a23795132
Implements: blueprint plugin-config-options
Closes-Bug: #1501508

commit_message:
Termination children on SIGHUP added

Reloading of application can be performed by sending HUP signal to
master process. But it is not useful right now because there should
be implemented many lines of code to support real reloading for each
of config options, and of course it is not implemented.

The easiest way to achieve reloading and applying configuration is
gracefully stop children and then respawn them.

When master process receives HUP signal it reloads it own
configuration, sends TERM signal to children to shutdown them
gracefully and respawns new children with updated config.

There is no impact on the user because sockets are still listening
in master process. So new requests will be put in queue.

Change-Id: I3e7264a1efcbf66a9afc69d8ed20f600c985c296
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.service refs/changes/14/224814/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: os.kill(pid, signal.SIGHUP)

commit_message:
Delete a temporary volume in DB with admin context

Non-disruptive backup creates a temporary volume. Information
of the volume will be deleted from DB if the volume cannot be
created by drivers. volume_destroy method is used in order to
delete the information. We must elevate the context to admin
context because the method requests admin context.

Change-Id: Ie5cd935cdd9e13c261708e504fa6fb2622a8aebb
Closes-Bug: 1502460
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/92/230792/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.db.volume_destroy(context.elevated(), temp_vol_ref['id'])
deleted_lines: self.db.volume_destroy(context, temp_vol_ref['id'])
